featureSection.heading: Structured Argumentation
featureSection.description: The Toulmin model provides a framework for analyzing and constructing arguments, making complex reasoning more accessible and persuasive.

clarity.title: Clarity in reasoning
clarity.description: Break down complex arguments into clear, connected components that anyone can follow and understand.

persuasion.title: Better persuasion
persuasion.description: Strengthen your arguments by anticipating rebuttals and providing solid backing for your claims.

academic.title: Academic excellence
academic.description: Widely used in academic writing and critical thinking courses to develop and evaluate arguments.

visualize.title: Visualize and share
visualize.description: Create beautiful diagrams that can be easily shared, exported, and embedded in presentations or documents.

universities.title: Universities
universities.headline: Enhance critical thinking courses
universities.description: Help students master argumentation skills with visual diagrams that make the Toulmin method intuitive and engaging.
features: Perfect for philosophy, rhetoric, and writing courses
Students can collaborate on argument analysis
Export diagrams for papers and presentations

bibleInstitutes.title: Bible Institutes
bibleInstitutes.headline: Strengthen theological reasoning
bibleInstitutes.description: Equip students to construct and analyze theological arguments with the same rigor used in academic philosophy.
features: Ideal for apologetics and hermeneutics courses
Ground biblical interpretation in logical structure

researchers.title: Researchers
researchers.headline: Clarify your research arguments
researchers.description: Use visual argumentation to strengthen research proposals, thesis statements, and academic papers.

items.quote: Toulmin Lab has transformed how my students understand argumentation. The visual approach makes abstract concepts tangible.
items.author: Dr. Sarah Mitchell

items.quote: Our apologetics students now construct much stronger arguments. The AI coach feature is particularly helpful for beginners.
items.author: Rev. James Chen

items.quote: Finally, a tool that makes the Toulmin model accessible to undergraduates. The export feature is perfect for assignments.
items.author: Prof. Maria Rodriguez

items.question: Is Toulmin Lab free to use?
items.answer: Yes! Toulmin Lab is free for all educators and students. Simply sign in with your Google account to get started. We may introduce premium features in the future, but the core functionality will always remain free.

items.question: What is the Toulmin model of argumentation?
items.answer: The Toulmin model, developed by philosopher Stephen Toulmin, breaks down arguments into six components: Claim, Grounds, Warrant, Backing, Qualifier, and Rebuttal. This structure helps analyze and construct logical arguments more effectively.

items.question: Can I use this for my class?
items.answer: Absolutely! Toulmin Lab is designed specifically for educational use. Students can create their own accounts, build diagrams, and export them for assignments. Professors can use the sample diagrams for teaching.

items.question: What is the AI Coach feature?
items.answer: The AI Coach guides you step-by-step through building a Toulmin argument. It asks questions about each component, provides feedback, and helps you strengthen your reasoning‚Äîperfect for students learning the method.

items.question: Can I export my diagrams?
items.answer: Yes! You can export your diagrams as PNG images or PDF documents. These exports are high-quality and perfect for including in papers, presentations, or course materials.

ctaSection.title: Ready to strengthen your arguments?
ctaSection.description: Join thousands of educators and students who use Toulmin Lab to build compelling, well-structured arguments.

coach.title: AI Argument Coach
coach.subtitle: Build your argument step by step with AI guidance

claim.definition: The main assertion or conclusion you want your audience to accept as true. It should be debatable, not a simple fact.
claim.example: Universities should require all students to take a course in critical thinking.
claim.antiPattern: Do NOT accept claims that are actually evidence (e.g., 'Studies show X') or simple facts (e.g., 'The sun rises in the east').

grounds.definition: The evidence, data, facts, or observations that support your claim. These are the concrete foundations for your argument.
grounds.example: A 2023 survey found that 78% of employers rate critical thinking as the most important skill they seek in graduates.
grounds.antiPattern: Do NOT accept grounds that are abstract principles or generalizations. Grounds should be specific and verifiable.

warrant.definition: The logical bridge connecting your grounds to your claim. Often expressed as a general principle or 'if-then' statement.
warrant.example: If a skill is highly valued by employers, universities should prioritize teaching that skill to prepare students for the workforce.
warrant.antiPattern: Do NOT accept warrants that are merely restating the claim or grounds. The warrant must explain WHY the grounds support the claim.

groundsBacking.definition: Support that establishes the credibility or reliability of your grounds. Can include source citations, methodology, or authority.
groundsBacking.example: The survey was conducted by the National Association of Colleges and Employers, which has tracked employer preferences since 1956.
groundsBacking.antiPattern: Do NOT accept backing that doesn't reference a source, authority, or methodology.

warrantBacking.definition: Support that establishes why the warrant (general principle) is valid. Can reference laws, theories, shared values, or established principles.
warrantBacking.example: The primary purpose of higher education, as stated in most university mission statements, is to prepare students for successful careers and civic life.
warrantBacking.antiPattern: Do NOT accept backing that doesn't explain why the logical principle in the warrant is valid.

qualifier.definition: Words or phrases indicating the strength of your claim. Qualifiers acknowledge that few claims are absolute.
qualifier.example: In most cases, probably, generally, typically, unless there are resource constraints.
qualifier.antiPattern: Be cautious of claims presented as absolute truths. Most honest arguments require some qualification.

rebuttal.definition: Acknowledgment of exceptions, counter-arguments, or conditions under which your claim might not hold.
rebuttal.example: This may not apply to highly specialized technical programs where curricula are already densely packed with required courses.
rebuttal.antiPattern: Do NOT accept rebuttals that are dismissive or don't genuinely engage with potential weaknesses.

completion.title: Argument Complete!
completion.message: Your Toulmin argument has been saved successfully. You can now view, edit, and export your argument diagram.

error.authRequired: Authentication required. Please sign in and try again.
error.processingFailed: I encountered an error processing your message. Please try again.
error.saveFailedRetry: Failed to save. Please try again.
error.unexpectedError: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.
error.rateLimitExceeded: You're sending messages too quickly. Please wait {seconds} seconds before trying again.
error.monthlyQuotaExceeded: You've reached your monthly AI coach limit. Resets on {resetDate} (UTC). You can continue editing your argument manually.
error.validationFailed: I couldn't understand that response. Please try rephrasing your message.
error.emptyResponse: I didn't receive a proper response. Please try again.
error.stepMismatch: There was a synchronization issue. Please refresh and try again.
error.streamFailed: The connection was interrupted. Please try sending your message again.

coach.welcome:
Welcome! I'm your Toulmin argument coach. I'll help you build a well-structured argument step by step.

Let's start with your **Claim** - the main assertion you want others to accept as true.

What are you trying to argue? What position do you want to take?
coach.autoContinue: I've confirmed this. Please continue to the next step.
coach.editStep: I'd like to revise this step. Please guide me.
coach.requestRewrite: Please rewrite your suggested text more concisely, keep my voice, and ask me to confirm.

quota.exhausted: Monthly limit reached. You can continue editing manually.

modals.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? All of the argument data will be permanently removed. This action cannot be undone.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.description: Terms and conditions for using Toulmin Lab

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using Toulmin Lab, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this agreement. If you do not agree to abide by these terms, please do not use this service.

description.title: 2. Description of Service
description.content: Toulmin Lab is an online platform that allows users to create, analyze, and share structured arguments using the Toulmin model of argumentation. The service includes an AI-powered coaching feature to help users build well-reasoned arguments.

accounts.title: 3. User Accounts
accounts.content: To use certain features of Toulmin Lab, you must create an account using Google authentication. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and for all activities that occur under your account.

useLicense.title: 4. Use License
useLicense.content: Permission is granted to temporarily use Toulmin Lab for personal, educational, and non-commercial purposes. This license does not include modifying or copying the materials, using the materials for commercial purposes, or attempting to decompile or reverse engineer any software contained in the service.

userContent.title: 5. User Content
userContent.content: You retain ownership of any arguments, diagrams, or other content you create using Toulmin Lab. By using the service, you grant us a limited license to store and display your content as necessary to provide the service.

prohibitedUses.title: 6. Prohibited Uses
prohibitedUses.content: You may not use Toulmin Lab for any unlawful purpose, to harass or harm others, to impersonate any person or entity, to interfere with the service's operation, or to attempt to gain unauthorized access to any portion of the service.

disclaimer.title: 7. Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: The materials on Toulmin Lab are provided on an 'as is' basis. We make no warranties, expressed or implied, and hereby disclaim and negate all other warranties including, without limitation, implied warranties or conditions of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement of intellectual property.

limitations.title: 8. Limitations
limitations.content: In no event shall Toulmin Lab or its suppliers be liable for any damages (including, without limitation, damages for loss of data or profit, or due to business interruption) arising out of the use or inability to use Toulmin Lab.

changes.title: 9. Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will notify users of any material changes by posting the new terms on this page. Your continued use of the service after such modifications constitutes your acceptance of the new terms.

contact.title: 10. Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us through our support channels.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: How we collect, use, and protect your information

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: At Toulmin Lab, we respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your information when you use our service.

dataCollection.title: 2. Information We Collect
dataCollection.content: We collect information you provide directly to us, including your name and email address when you sign in with Google. We also collect information about your usage of the service, including the arguments and diagrams you create.

dataUsage.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
dataUsage.content: We use your information to provide and improve our service, to communicate with you about your account, to respond to your requests, and to send you updates about the service. We may also use aggregated, anonymized data for analytics purposes.

dataStorage.title: 4. Data Storage and Security
dataStorage.content: Your data is stored securely using industry-standard encryption and security practices. We use trusted cloud service providers to host our service and store your data. We retain your data for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you with our services.

cookies.title: 5. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to maintain your session, remember your preferences, and analyze how our service is used. You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences.

thirdParties.title: 6. Third-Party Services
thirdParties.content: We use third-party services for authentication (Google), analytics (Vercel Analytics), and AI features (OpenAI). These services may collect information about you according to their own privacy policies.

userRights.title: 7. Your Rights
userRights.content: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal data. You can also request a copy of your data or ask us to restrict processing. To exercise these rights, please contact us through our support channels.

security.title: 8. Security Measures
security.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.

children.title: 9. Children's Privacy
children.content: Toulmin Lab is intended for use by students and educators. If you are under 13 years of age, please use the service only with parental or guardian supervision. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13 without parental consent.

changes.title: 10. Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the 'Last updated' date.

contact.title: 11. Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us through our support channels.
